title: Anders Ramsrud's drone video shows Norway's beauty spots in the midnight sun

This mesmerising footage captured by a drone is giving viewers a rare look at one of the most spectacular experiences on earth.
The video offers a sky-high view of Norway’s Donnamannen Mountain while the sun shines brightly in the sky – at midnight.
It’s a revealing look at one of Norway’s best beauty spots at a moment when the country’s Arctic region experienced 24 hours of sunlight.
Impossibly beautiful footage of Norway's Arctic midnight sun The midnight sun occurs when the Earth’s axis tilts and the North Pole faces the sun
The video offers a sky-high view of Donnamannen Mountain while the sun shines brightly at midnight
The fascinating aerial shots were captured by Anders Ramsrud, who scaled the 2,800ft peak with friends during Norway’s midnight sun.

The spectacular scenes show endless views of the sea and snow-capped peaks in the glow of the sun
The spectacular scenes show endless views of the sea and snow-capped peaks in the glow of the late-night sun.
In this region, the sun never sets during summer, and it offers the tourists who flock here by car or cruise ship a magnificent experience.
The phenomenon is caused by the tilt in the Earth’s axis, with the tilt making the North Pole face towards the sun.
